body:
### Description

file structure:
```
aoc <-- path that is :cd into
|-Cargo.toml <-- rust-analyzer should use this Cargo.toml: true project root
|-src
  |-lib.rs
|-two022 <-- rust-analyzer uses this Cargo.toml instead
  |-Cargo.toml
  |-src
    |-main.rs <-- :e two022\src\main.rs
```

rust-analyzer if run from true project root:
```diff
+ C:\Users\..\aoc>rust-analyzer diagnostics .
processing crate: 2022, module: C:\Users\..\aoc\two022\src\main.rs
-
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("inactive-code"), message: "code is inactive due to #[cfg] directives: feature = \"day2\" is disabled", range: 131..188, severity: WeakWarning, unused: true, experimental: false, fixes: None }
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-macro-call"), message: "unresolved macro `print!`", range: 112..117, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }
processing crate: aoc, module: C:\Users\..\aoc\src\lib.rs
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-import"), message: "unresolved import", range: 15..17, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-import"), message: "unresolved import", range: 28..32, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-import"), message: "unresolved import", range: 34..38, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }

diagnostic scan complete

[ERROR rust_analyzer] Unexpected error: diagnostic error detected
diagnostic error detected
```
rust-analyzer now:
```diff
+ C:\Users\..\aoc>rust-analyzer diagnostics two022
processing crate: two022, module: C:\Users\..\aoc\two022\src\main.rs
- Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("inactive-code"), message: "code is inactive due to #[cfg] directives: feature = \"day1\" is disabled", range: 72..129, severity: WeakWarning, unused: true, experimental: false, fixes: None }
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("inactive-code"), message: "code is inactive due to #[cfg] directives: feature = \"day2\" is disabled", range: 131..188, severity: WeakWarning, unused: true, experimental: false, fixes: None }
processing crate: aoc, module: C:\Users\..\aoc\src\lib.rs
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-import"), message: "unresolved import", range: 15..17, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-import"), message: "unresolved import", range: 28..32, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }
Diagnostic { code: DiagnosticCode("unresolved-import"), message: "unresolved import", range: 34..38, severity: Error, unused: false, experimental: true, fixes: None }

diagnostic scan complete

[ERROR rust_analyzer] Unexpected error: diagnostic error detected
diagnostic error detected
```

### Neovim version

NVIM v0.9.0-dev-903+gecc40660d
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3

### Nvim-lspconfig version

b5bb6e3d7c775c241726d1ef564902263e93e2cd

### Operating system and version

Windows 10 Pro

### Affected language servers

rust-analyzer

### Steps to reproduce

1. use default config
2. `nvim`
3. `:cd ....\aoc`
4. `:e two022\src\main.rs`
5. `:LspInfo` shows that root is at `....\aoc\two022` instead of at `....\aoc`

### Actual behavior

above

### Expected behavior

above

### Minimal config

```Lua
local on_windows = vim.loop.os_uname().version:match 'Windows'

local function join_paths(...)
  local path_sep = on_windows and '\\' or '/'
  local result = table.concat({ ... }, path_sep)
  return result
end

vim.cmd [[set runtimepath=$VIMRUNTIME]]

local temp_dir = vim.loop.os_getenv 'TEMP' or '/tmp'

vim.cmd('set packpath=' .. join_paths(temp_dir, 'nvim', 'site'))

local package_root = join_paths(temp_dir, 'nvim', 'site', 'pack')
local lspconfig_path = join_paths(package_root, 'test', 'start', 'nvim-lspconfig')

if vim.fn.isdirectory(lspconfig_path) ~= 1 then
  vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', 'https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig', lspconfig_path }
end

vim.lsp.set_log_level 'trace'
require('vim.lsp.log').set_format_func(vim.inspect)
local nvim_lsp = require 'lspconfig'
local on_attach = function(_, bufnr)
  local function buf_set_option(...)
    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_option(bufnr, ...)
  end

  buf_set_option('omnifunc', 'v:lua.vim.lsp.omnifunc')

  -- Mappings.
  local opts = { buffer = bufnr, noremap = true, silent = true }
  vim.keymap.set('n', 'gD', vim.lsp.buf.declaration, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', 'gd', vim.lsp.buf.definition, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', 'K', vim.lsp.buf.hover, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', 'gi', vim.lsp.buf.implementation, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-k>', vim.lsp.buf.signature_help, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>wa', vim.lsp.buf.add_workspace_folder, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>wr', vim.lsp.buf.remove_workspace_folder, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>wl', function()
    print(vim.inspect(vim.lsp.buf.list_workspace_folders()))
  end, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>D', vim.lsp.buf.type_definition, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>rn', vim.lsp.buf.rename, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', 'gr', vim.lsp.buf.references, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>e', vim.diagnostic.open_float, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '[d', vim.diagnostic.goto_prev, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', ']d', vim.diagnostic.goto_next, opts)
  vim.keymap.set('n', '<space>q', vim.diagnostic.setloclist, opts)
end

-- Add the server that troubles you here
local name = 'rust_analyzer'
if not name then
  print 'You have not defined a server name, please edit minimal_init.lua'
end
if not nvim_lsp[name].document_config.default_config.cmd and not cmd then
  print [[You have not defined a server default cmd for a server
    that requires it please edit minimal_init.lua]]
end

nvim_lsp[name].setup {
  cmd = cmd,
  on_attach = on_attach,
}

print [[You can find your log at $HOME/.cache/nvim/lsp.log. Please paste in a github issue under a details tag as described in the issue template.]]
```


### LSP log

https://gist.github.com/LollipopFt/dd0b5d812ab5905babe3ac049d13c646

comment_data.body: try with the example folder i was testing on: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer/files/10688137/aoc.zip

relate https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/2400 https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/1908

both need parent as root dir.

Is there a way that we can configure this behavior (i.e., to use the child directory as the root)? My `rust-analyzer` instance takes forever to parse a massive project I'm in, when I really just want to be working in a smaller crate in the library.

title: getting root dir  not correct
